pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:0.5: 85. The training rule on entering an inhabited area at the wrong time
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six entered the village at the wrong time, sat down in the public meeting hall, and talked about all sorts of pointless things:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.3: about kings, gangsters, and officials; about armies, dangers, and battles; about food, drink, clothes, and beds; about garlands and perfumes; about relatives, vehicles, villages, towns, and countries; about women and heroes; gossip; about the departed; about various trivialities; about the world and the sea; about the various kinds of existence.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.5: “How can the Sakyan ascetics enter the village at the wrong time, sit down in the public meeting hall, and talk about such pointless things?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.7: They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.8: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.9: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.10: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.13: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.18: “… Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.21: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.22: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.23.1: ‘If a monk enters an inhabited area at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.24: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1: Soon afterwards a number of monks were walking through the Kosalan country toward Sāvatthī, when one evening they came to a certain village.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.5: But knowing that entering a village at the wrong time had been prohibited by the Buddha and being afraid of wrongdoing, they declined.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.7: They then went to Sāvatthī and told the monks what had happened,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.8: who in turn told the Buddha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.9: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.10: “Monks, I allow you to enter an inhabited area at the wrong time after taking leave.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.11: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.12.1: ‘If a monk, without taking leave, enters an inhabited area at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.13: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1: Soon afterwards a monk was walking through the Kosalan country toward Sāvatthī, when one evening he came to a certain village.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.5: But knowing that entering a village at the wrong time without taking leave had been prohibited by the Buddha and being afraid of wrongdoing, he declined.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.7: He then went to Sāvatthī and told the monks what had happened,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.8: who in turn told the Buddha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.9: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.10: “Monks, I allow you to enter an inhabited area at the wrong time after taking leave of an available monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.11: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.12.1: ‘If a monk, when a monk is available, enters an inhabited area at the wrong time without taking leave of him, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.13: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1: Soon afterwards a monk was bitten by a snake.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.2: Another monk went to the village to get fire.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.4: that the Buddha has prohibited entering a village at the wrong time without taking leave of an available monk. And being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not enter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.6: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.7: “Monks, I allow you to enter an inhabited area at the wrong time without taking leave of an available monk if there is some appropriate urgent business.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.8: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.9.1: ‘If a monk, when another monk is available, enters an inhabited area at the wrong time without taking leave of him, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.12: if he crosses the boundary of an enclosed inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.13: If he enters the vicinity of an unenclosed inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.14: Except if there is some appropriate urgent business:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.15: unless there is some appropriate urgent business.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.1: If it is the wrong time, and he perceives it as such, and he enters an inhabited area without taking leave of an available monk, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.2: If it is the wrong time, but he is unsure of it, and he enters an inhabited area without taking leave of an available monk, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.3: If it is the wrong time, but he perceives it as the right time, and he enters an inhabited area without taking leave of an available monk, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.4: If it is the right time, but he perceives it as the wrong time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.5: If it is the right time, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.6: If it is the right time, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.4: if he enters without taking leave when there is no available monk;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.7: if he is going to the dwelling place of the ascetics of another religion;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.8: if he is returning to the monastery;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.13: The third rule, the training rule on entering an inhabited area at the wrong time, is finished.
